text: {{Infobox Writer | name = Alphonse Daudet | image = Alphonse Daudet.jpg | birth_date = | birth_place = Nîmes, France | death_date = | death_place = Paris, France | occupation = Novelist, Short story writer, Playwright, Poet | movement = Naturalism | genre = | notableworks = }} Alphonse Daudet (13 May 1840 – 16 December 1897) was a French novelist. He was the father of Léon Daudet and Lucien Daudet. Outside France he is probably best known for his novel Tartarin de Tarrascon. Daudet died of syphilis. title: Alphonse Daudet
